Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Scarabe's Mansion

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・スカラベの屋敷
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Scarabe's Mansion

Entry.JapaneseText: ふふふ…… 女王に似ているガジュマか。 スージーも喜ぶだろう……
Entry.EnglishText: Hehehe... A Gajuma that looks just like just like the Queen, huh? Susie should be pleased.

Entry.JapaneseText: それにしてもスージー…… どこへ行ったというのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Speaking of Susie... Where has that girl run off to?

Entry.JapaneseText: スージー！ 何をしておった？ あれほど、ひとりで出歩くなと 言ったのに……忘れたか？ おまえは一度……
Entry.EnglishText: Susie! Where were you? I told you not to go walking around on your own, didn't I? Did you forget? I already lost you once...

Entry.JapaneseText: もう、心配しすぎよ、お父様。 以前のような事はもうないって 聞いてるし……
Entry.EnglishText: Honestly, father, you worry too much. Everyone says that won't happen again...

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか……いえ、でも…… そんなまさか…… だってそっくりだもの…… お父様、まさかこの方、女王様？
Entry.EnglishText: It can't be... No, but she... There's no way... She looks just like her... Father, don't tell me that this is the Queen?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は女王じゃありません、 私は……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not the Queen. I'm...

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな事はわかっている。 本物の女王が、ひとりであんな ところにいるわけがない。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, I know. The real Queen would never be in a place like this all by herself.

Entry.JapaneseText: で、でも…… こんなに似てるなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: B-but... She looks just like her...

Entry.JapaneseText: スージー、このガジュマを おまえ付きのメイドにしてやろう。 部屋へ連れていって、 好きなように使うといい。
Entry.EnglishText: Susie, this Gajuma is going to serve as your personal maid. Take her to your room and have her do your bidding.

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ そんな…… 私、いらないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? I can't do that... I don't even need a maid.

Entry.JapaneseText: まあ、そう言うな。 <Blue>王の盾<White>に捕われた時に 味わった憂さを、この娘で ぞんぶんに晴らしてはどうだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Please, don't be like that. Why not take all the sorrow you experienced when you were kidnapped by the <Blue>Royal Shield<White> out on this girl?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうか、あんたたちは 娘の恩人だったのか。
Entry.EnglishText: I see. So you are the ones I have to thank for saving my daughter.

Entry.JapaneseText: せっかく来てくださったんだもの、 今晩はウチに泊まっていただいても いいでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Since they took the time to stop by, is it all right if we let them stay here for the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、もちろん。 だが……そちらのガジュマには 遠慮してもらおう。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, of course. However, I can't extend that offer to the Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: そのガジュマはあんたらの従僕だろ？ 残念ながら、この屋敷には 客の従僕のための部屋は 用意してないのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma is your servant, right? I'm sorry, but our mansion has no rooms to accommodate the servants of our guests.

Entry.JapaneseText: 従僕だなんて……！ この人は召使いじゃありません。 <Eugene>はわたしたちの仲間……
Entry.EnglishText: You're calling him a servant?! He is no such thing! <Eugene> is our friend!

Entry.JapaneseText: わかりました。 私は宿に戻ります。
Entry.EnglishText: I understand. I'll stay at the inn.

Entry.JapaneseText: だったら、ボクたちも一緒に帰るヨ！ ねえ、みんな？
Entry.EnglishText: Well then, the rest of us are going back there too! Right, guys?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……スージー、すまないが オレたちは宿屋に帰る。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, Susie, but we'll all be sleeping at the inn tonight.

Entry.JapaneseText: せめてお食事だけでも……
Entry.EnglishText: Will you at least stay for dinner...?

Entry.JapaneseText: いえ、遠慮しておくわ。 あなたのお父さんの渋い顔を見ながら、 食事する気にはなれないもの。
Entry.EnglishText: No thanks, we'll pass. Just looking at your father's rotten face made me lose my appetite.

Entry.JapaneseText: それで？ ワシに、ガジュマとの 話し合いの場を持てと？
Entry.EnglishText: So, you're asking me to hold a meeting with those Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい……ガジュマを街から追い出して、 あんな貧しい暮らしを強いるなんて 間違っていませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. Do you not think that it was wrong of you to drive the Gajuma out of town and force them to live in abject poverty?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本来、ガジュマもヒューマも お互いがお互いを認め合って 仲良く暮らしてきたはずでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma and Huma here in Belsas originally respected one another and resided together here peacefully, did they not?

Entry.JapaneseText: 話をしてもらえませんか？ 彼らの訴えを聞いてください。
Entry.EnglishText: I would like for you to speak with them. Please listen to their concerns.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……断る。 どうして、おまえにそんな事を 指示されなければならないのだ？
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse. Why do you feel the need to boss me around over this?

Entry.JapaneseText: 指示だなんて…… ただ、わたくしは胸が痛いんです。 誰もが仲良く暮らすべきなのに、 こんな状況で……
Entry.EnglishText: I mean no disrespect! It's just that... it pains me to see things like this. Everyone should be able to live together in harmony, and yet the situation here is so dire...

Entry.JapaneseText: これが、この街のやり方だ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's just the way things are here.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも……でも…… その街のやり方っていうのが 間違ってるって思うんです。
Entry.EnglishText: But... I... I believe that the way things are here is wrong!

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん……大方、スラムのガジュマに 女王にまつり上げられて、 その気になってるんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph. I bet you're only doing this because those Gajuma from the slums set you up as their Queen. Well...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何をそそのかされたかは知らんが、 いい気になるなよ!! 偽者めが！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know what they're putting you up to, but don't let it get to your head, you imposter!

Entry.JapaneseText: そうじゃないんです！ ……ただ！
Entry.EnglishText: No, I was merely...!

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさい!! 誰か、誰か！
Entry.EnglishText: Shut up! Somebody, somebody come quickly!

Entry.JapaneseText: こいつを空いている部屋に 閉じ込めておけ。 少し頭を冷やせば、落ち着くだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: Find an empty room to lock her up in. She needs to cool her little head off.

Entry.JapaneseText: せめて、彼らの話を 聞いてください！ お願いです！
Entry.EnglishText: At least listen to the Gajuma! Please! I beg of you!

Entry.JapaneseText: いいから来い!!
Entry.EnglishText: Get moving!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そっとしといて…… 今は何も考えられないの……
Entry.EnglishText: Please leave me be... I don't want to think about...

Entry.JapaneseText: お父様……お父様が…… どうしてこんな事に……
Entry.EnglishText: F-Father... Why is my Father...

Entry.JapaneseText: スージーさん、元気を出して。 ミルハウストさんは、 悪いようにはしないって……
Entry.EnglishText: Please cheer up, Susie... Milhaust will not let him fall into harm...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたのせいじゃない！ 何もかも、あなたのせいよ！ あなたの……
Entry.EnglishText: It was your fault in the first place! It was your fault... Your... fault...

Entry.JapaneseText: あれから色々考えたの。 女王様は許せないけど…… お父様も悪かったって……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been reflecting ever since that happened. I... can't bring myself to forgive Her Highness, but... my father was also in the wrong.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほんとは私、お父様が ガジュマの事を悪く言ったり、 いじわるしたりするのって、 キライだった……
Entry.EnglishText: To be honest, I hated how Father spoke badly of and tormented Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: お父様のせいで、街の人たちも イヤな思いをしたでしょうから、 その分、私は私にできる事を がんばろうと思って……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of my father's actions, the people in this town have suffered greatly. That is why I must do what I can to atone...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここのところ、また少し 街の雰囲気が悪くなってる……
Entry.EnglishText: Things have been a bit hectic lately. And the tension in the air has only grown.
Entry.Notes: rewrote it using deepl as a guide. want it checked.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、私、みんなが 仲良くなるように がんばろうと思うの……
Entry.EnglishText: But... I want everyone to get along with each other. So I'm going to do my best!

Entry.JapaneseText: 一度憎しみ合ってしまったら、 簡単には元のようにはなれないと 思う……でも……
Entry.EnglishText: It is no simple matter for two groups to come together once they've begun to hate each other, however...

Entry.JapaneseText: あきらめてしまったら、 そこで終わりだものね…… 私……がんばるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: There would be no more opportunities to change things if I were to give up, which is why I must give it my all!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんなのかしら、この音…… 街の人たちもみんな、 不安そうにしてるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what this sound is...? The townspeople seem somewhat anxious...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、ようやくわかって来たの…… 元に戻るよりも、新しい関係を 作る事が大事なんじゃないかって……
Entry.EnglishText: I have finally understood that it is better to forge newer bonds than return to how it used to be...

Entry.JapaneseText: お父様……元気かしら…… カゼなんて…… ひいてないかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if Father is doing well? I hope he won't catch a cold...
